title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 22 May 2009 - XWiki
content:
glerouge left at 00:00 ("Gone chasing a unicorn in the twilight zone")  
anamarias left at 00:18 ()  
kraze joined #xwiki at 00:47  
kraze - (22/05/2009 00:48): I'm going through my xwiki upgrade process again and noticed that, in catalina.out, I'm getting a No FormBeanConfig found under 'skin' warning quite often  
sdumitriu - (22/05/2009 00:48): You can ignore it  
sdumitriu - (22/05/2009 00:48): It's normal  
sdumitriu - (22/05/2009 00:49): Actually it shouldn't be printed, but it's OK to have it  
kraze - (22/05/2009 00:49): interesting.  ok  
florinciu left at 01:19 ("ChatZilla 0.9.84 [Firefox 3.0.10/2009042316]")  
kraze - (22/05/2009 01:25): between upgrading from 0.9.840 to 1.0, I lost my left/right pane layout.  is it easy to get those back?  
sdumitriu - (22/05/2009 01:25): .9 didn't have Panels, AFAIK  
sdumitriu - (22/05/2009 01:26): It had two included documents  
kraze - (22/05/2009 01:26): it doesn't, but I did have a left/right side.  right side contained our search field, recently signed up (new) users, etc  
sdumitriu - (22/05/2009 01:26): A quick solution is to transform those documents into panels  
sdumitriu - (22/05/2009 01:27): It shouldn't be hard  
kraze - (22/05/2009 01:27): I don't think 1.0 has panels either  
kraze - (22/05/2009 01:27): I wouldn't bother with this but my live upgrade will be handled in steps over a period of time  
kraze - (22/05/2009 01:29): I think phase 1 of up mygrade will go from 0.9.840 and increment my way up to 1.4.1 (all of this handled in the term of 1 business day)  
kraze - (22/05/2009 01:29): then phase 2 will go from 1.4.1 to 1.8.3 or whatever's latest  
kraze - (22/05/2009 01:31): hmm, there are panels in 1.1  
kraze - (22/05/2009 01:31): I'll check that out  
kraze - (22/05/2009 01:32): or if I'm going to 1.4.1 in the course of 1 business day, I'll see what I can work with when I get there  
gwash joined #xwiki at 01:44  
kraze - (22/05/2009 01:47): I'm at 1.4.1 now.  how would I go about transforming those documents into panels?  
sdumitriu - (22/05/2009 01:47): Go to Panels.WebHome  
sdumitriu - (22/05/2009 01:48): Create a new panel  
sdumitriu - (22/05/2009 01:48): And inside it put the content of the left document  
sdumitriu - (22/05/2009 01:48): Do you know its name?  
kraze - (22/05/2009 01:48): let me see  
sdumitriu - (22/05/2009 01:49): I think it's XWiki.Menu or something like that  
kraze - (22/05/2009 01:50): it's not in the xwiki code if I edit that page  
kraze - (22/05/2009 01:50): scrolling seems to follow the page, so it makes it look like it's part of it  
kraze - (22/05/2009 01:51): they're still there if I go from one page to another within xwiki  
kraze - (22/05/2009 01:51): ok, if I go to Admin, at the bottom, there's a link to "Menu on the left"  
kraze - (22/05/2009 01:52): and "Toolbar on the right"  
kraze - (22/05/2009 01:52): under Presentation  
kraze - (22/05/2009 01:53): interesting  
kraze - (22/05/2009 01:53): how do I get to Panels.WebHome?  
sdumitriu - (22/05/2009 01:54): Yes, Menu on the left and Toolbar on the right should be the two documents  
sdumitriu - (22/05/2009 01:54): Open them in two tabs  
kraze - (22/05/2009 01:55): ok, I'm looking at the Toolbar code now  
sdumitriu - (22/05/2009 01:55): Hm, the problem with the panels is that you need to import the Panels application before you can create new panels  
kraze - (22/05/2009 01:55): I've imported Panels into my 1.4.1 test environment  
kraze - (22/05/2009 01:55): I just don't see it anywhere  
kraze - (22/05/2009 01:56): Ahh, found it under Layout  
kraze - (22/05/2009 01:57): I had to click on Administration under the XWiki logo on the left  
kraze - (22/05/2009 01:57): the Administration link on the right takes me somewhere else  
kraze - (22/05/2009 01:59): Toolbar contains search, members and recently visited which I think I should be able to re-create using what's available in panels  
kraze - (22/05/2009 02:02): panels in 1.4.1 isn't managable like it is in current XWiki (not drag/drop).  how do I edit, say, the Search feature to the right?  
kraze - (22/05/2009 02:02): maybe I should just try the wizard  
sdumitriu - (22/05/2009 02:03): The panel wizard \*should\* work fine  
kraze - (22/05/2009 02:03): ahh, it is in the wizard.  I was in a different view  
sdumitriu - (22/05/2009 02:03): If it's not working, you should edit the XWikiPreferences page using the object editor  
sdumitriu - (22/05/2009 02:03): Search for the panels-related fields  
sdumitriu - (22/05/2009 02:03): And write the name of the panels directly in there  
kraze - (22/05/2009 02:09): Hmm, my Menu on the left has News but I can't find a panel for news  
sdumitriu - (22/05/2009 02:10): What kind of news?  
kraze - (22/05/2009 02:10): and some other box that has no label  
kraze - (22/05/2009 02:10): well, it says "News (Edit Categories)" at the top and two bulleted items: Business Continuity Planning, Asset Management  
gwash left at 02:11 (Read error: 113 (No route to host))  
kraze - (22/05/2009 02:11): below that is a "Add a News" box with a field to give the news item a name and "Add this news" button  
kraze - (22/05/2009 02:11): I'll edit it to see if I can make heads or tails of it  
sdumitriu - (22/05/2009 02:11): I guess those are blog posts  
lucaa left at 02:12 (Read error: 54 (Connection reset by peer))  
sdumitriu - (22/05/2009 02:12): Which means that you should import the Blog application  
kraze - (22/05/2009 02:12): looks l ike it.  I see "#set ($blogcatdoc = $xwiki.getDocument("Blog.Categories")))"  
sdumitriu - (22/05/2009 02:12): But it doesn't fully work with 1.4  
kraze - (22/05/2009 02:13): ok, I think they can get by without that until 1.8.3  
sdumitriu - (22/05/2009 02:13): Yes  
kraze - (22/05/2009 02:13): the main thing I needed was search which I have now  
sdumitriu - (22/05/2009 02:13): And the remaining fragment?  
kraze - (22/05/2009 02:13): I don't think any of the remaining stuff is important  
kraze - (22/05/2009 02:14): one was to add news (related to this blog feature) and the one above news with no identifiable title header ... appears to be a custom entry that's not pulling data from any speical area  
kraze - (22/05/2009 02:15): bulleted items such as "Service Outage Analysis>Main.SOA", "Business Continuity Planning.Home"  
sdumitriu - (22/05/2009 02:16): You can create a new panel for that, or you can edit the QuickLinks panel to add those links in it  
kraze - (22/05/2009 02:27): ok, let me save what I have from the default selection and work on that  
kraze - (22/05/2009 02:34): hmm, for the first bulleted item "Service Outage Analysis.Home", it shows up on the first bullet as "Service Outage Analysis" and the second bulleted item is "Home"  
kraze - (22/05/2009 02:34): which should be "Business Continuity Planning.Home"  
kraze - (22/05/2009 02:35): http://pastebin.com/m7fc2007f  
kraze - (22/05/2009 02:35): there's the code  
kraze - (22/05/2009 02:37): http://yfrog.com/5einfojp  
kraze - (22/05/2009 02:37): there's a screenshot  
sdumitriu - (22/05/2009 02:39): What is the original code?  
kraze - (22/05/2009 02:41): exactly the same  
kraze - (22/05/2009 02:41): I'll pastebin some before/after it as well  
kraze - (22/05/2009 02:41): http://pastebin.com/m7f30718f  
kraze - (22/05/2009 02:42): I fixed "Business Continuity Planning"  
sdumitriu - (22/05/2009 02:43): Try one of these:  
sdumitriu - (22/05/2009 02:43): \* [Elstee IT Services Site Handbook>XWiki.Elstee IT Services Site Handbook]  
sdumitriu - (22/05/2009 02:43): \* [Daylight Saving Time Issues>XWiki.Daylight Saving Time Issues]  
sdumitriu - (22/05/2009 02:43): \* [Elstee IT Services Site Handbook>Main.Elstee IT Services Site Handbook]  
sdumitriu - (22/05/2009 02:43): \* [Daylight Saving Time Issues>Main.Daylight Saving Time Issues]  
sdumitriu - (22/05/2009 02:44): Or no, in the original wiki, where do they point to? Can you paste the URL?  
sdumitriu - (22/05/2009 02:45): (You can remove the hostname if you want)  
kraze - (22/05/2009 02:45): http://wiki.arc.com:8080/xwiki/bin/view/Main/Elstee+IT+Services+Site+Handbook  
kraze - (22/05/2009 02:45): http://wiki.arc.com:8080/xwiki/bin/view/Main/Daylight+Saving+Time+Issues  
kraze - (22/05/2009 02:45): Main. fixed it  
kraze - (22/05/2009 02:47): I see the new panel int he wizard, but it doesn't have a nifty box around it to allow drag/drop operation  
kraze - (22/05/2009 02:47): looks like I need to add extra code for that  
kraze - (22/05/2009 02:47): I'll look at an existing panel  
sdumitriu - (22/05/2009 02:48): Yes  
kraze - (22/05/2009 02:52): had to add a headder and footer  
kraze - (22/05/2009 02:53): not adding a footer causes a strange issue with trying to drag/drop it, and my other panels that were already added were not showing :-)  
kraze - (22/05/2009 02:53): it's beautiful now :-)  
kraze - (22/05/2009 02:58): brb, new CEO has a speech about how he's going to reduce costs and cut IT from the budget  
sdumitriu - (22/05/2009 02:58): I'll go to sleep soon  
sdumitriu - (22/05/2009 02:59): See you tomorrow  
kraze - (22/05/2009 02:59): ok, danke again for your help  
kraze - (22/05/2009 02:59): have a good night  
sdumitriu - (22/05/2009 02:59): Thanks  
kraze left at 03:47 ("ircII EPIC4-2.6 -- Are we there yet?")  
sdumitriu left at 03:48 (Read error: 113 (No route to host))  
arunreddy\_ is now known as arunreddy|afk ([[email protected]](https://dev.xwiki.org/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection))  
kraze joined #xwiki at 04:21  
kraze left at 06:18 ("A yawn is a silent shout.")  
rrodriguez joined #xwiki at 06:55  
rrodriguez left at 07:23 ()  
arunreddy joined #xwiki at 07:43  
arunreddy|afk left at 07:44 (Read error: 113 (No route to host))  
jumpkick joined #xwiki at 07:59  
mflorea joined #xwiki at 08:30  
jumpkick left #xwiki at 08:37  
rrodriguez joined #xwiki at 08:41  
arunreddy\_ joined #xwiki at 08:41  
arunreddy left at 08:41 (Read error: 54 (Connection reset by peer))  
vmassol joined #xwiki at 08:48  
mflorea left at 09:05 ("Leaving")  
cypromis joined #xwiki at 09:20  
arkub joined #xwiki at 09:36  
tuska joined #xwiki at 09:37  
cypromis left at 09:45 ("Leaving")  
cypromis joined #xwiki at 09:47  
rrodriguez left at 10:01 ()  
sdumitriu joined #xwiki at 10:02  
vmassol left at 10:03 ()  
kaaloo joined #xwiki at 10:07  
vmassol joined #xwiki at 10:17  
vmassol left at 10:18 (Client Quit)  
arunreddy\_ - (22/05/2009 10:20): sdumitriu : Hi  
sdumitriu - (22/05/2009 10:20): Hello  
arunreddy\_ - (22/05/2009 10:21): I have updated : http://gsoc.myxwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Import+Export+other+wikis/  
sdumitriu - (22/05/2009 10:21): Ok, I'll look at it soon  
mflorea joined #xwiki at 10:21  
arunreddy\_ - (22/05/2009 10:21): Just want to know whether its sufficient or something more in detail.  
arunreddy\_ - (22/05/2009 10:21): Sure, in your free time  
arunreddy\_ - (22/05/2009 10:21): :)  
glerouge joined #xwiki at 10:26  
lucaa joined #xwiki at 10:27  
lucaa left at 10:51 ("Leaving.")  
glerouge left at 11:38 (Read error: 54 (Connection reset by peer))  
glerouge joined #xwiki at 11:39  
rrodriguez joined #xwiki at 11:41  
asyd - (22/05/2009 11:51): helo there  
KermitTheFragger joined #xwiki at 12:12  
tachirei joined #xwiki at 13:05  
tharindu joined #xwiki at 13:24  
rrodriguez left at 13:29 ()  
tachirei left #xwiki at 14:05  
florinciu joined #xwiki at 14:28  
vmassol\_ joined #xwiki at 14:53  
tharindu left at 15:05 ("Leaving")  
arunreddy\_ - (22/05/2009 15:26): vmassol\_ : Hi  
arunreddy\_\_ joined #xwiki at 15:31  
arunreddy\_\_ is now known as arunreddy ([[email protected]](https://dev.xwiki.org/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection))  
vmassol\_ - (22/05/2009 15:31): sdumitriu: please don't commit non bugs to RC1  
vmassol\_ - (22/05/2009 15:32): see my comments on skype + jira issue  
sdumitriu - (22/05/2009 15:32): Hi  
vmassol\_ - (22/05/2009 15:32): hi  
sdumitriu - (22/05/2009 15:32): Sorry, didn't see  
vmassol\_ - (22/05/2009 15:32): we discussed it 2 days ago  
sdumitriu - (22/05/2009 15:32): I had skype on a different desktop  
vmassol\_ - (22/05/2009 15:32): that we could commit on RC1 till sunday night   
vmassol\_ - (22/05/2009 15:32): but only for important bug fices  
vmassol\_ - (22/05/2009 15:32): fixes  
vmassol\_ - (22/05/2009 15:33): since we want to release first time monday morning  
vmassol\_ - (22/05/2009 15:35): sdumitriu: hope you're confident about your changes that they fully work ;)  
sdumitriu - (22/05/2009 15:36): Yes  
vmassol\_ - (22/05/2009 15:36): (since I don't think many people will have time to test)  
vmassol\_ - (22/05/2009 15:36): (in France most people are on holiday  
vmassol\_ - (22/05/2009 15:36): )  
sdumitriu - (22/05/2009 15:36): One thing was removed: the search no longer displays action buttons (delete, copy, rename, edit rights)  
vmassol\_ - (22/05/2009 15:36): like I am ;)  
arunreddy - (22/05/2009 15:36): vmassol\_ : Have one doubt. Are we supposed to design the import process for all the possible export types of a wiki. or the best ones that suit us.?  
vmassol\_ - (22/05/2009 15:37): arunreddy: export types?  
sdumitriu - (22/05/2009 15:37): arunreddy: start with the most important ones  
arunreddy - (22/05/2009 15:37): Xml, Html,  
arunreddy - (22/05/2009 15:37): ok  
sdumitriu - (22/05/2009 15:37): If the architecture is right, adding support for another format should take at most 2 days  
arunreddy - (22/05/2009 15:38): ok  
vmassol\_ - (22/05/2009 15:40): arunreddy: yes I mentioned using one in my email  
vmassol\_ - (22/05/2009 15:41): what's important is to get a working chain asap  
vmassol\_ - (22/05/2009 15:42): first design (which you have started doing) , then planning/roadmap (still pending) then work on milestone 1  
arunreddy - (22/05/2009 15:48): Yeah, in the begning little confused whether am proceeding the right direction. Thanks for your mail got some idea now. I will finish the Planning and UI mockups to the earliest possible. and start with milestone 1  
vmassol\_ - (22/05/2009 15:49): great!  
arunreddy - (22/05/2009 15:50): some light on :   
arunreddy - (22/05/2009 15:50): the  
arunreddy - (22/05/2009 15:51): integration points  (target svn location, jira projects, etc)  
arunreddy - (22/05/2009 15:53): sdumitriu : Am new to this process. some help.  
arunreddy\_ left at 15:53 (Read error: 113 (No route to host))  
kraze joined #xwiki at 16:00  
kraze - (22/05/2009 16:08): goodmorning  
glerouge left at 16:17 ("Gone chasing a unicorn in the twilight zone")  
kraze - (22/05/2009 16:36): in a test environment, I've been working on an upgrade from 0.9.840 to 1.8.4.  During each major revision upgrade, I've imported the default XAR (also choosing "with history).  I'm at 1.8.4 now and notice that history for all of my pages are gone and the only version that is shown is the current.  should I have lost my old page histories anywhere during this upgrade?  
sdumitriu - (22/05/2009 16:44): kraze: "With history" = the imported xar history, not your wiki's history  
kraze - (22/05/2009 16:48): ok  
kraze - (22/05/2009 16:49): can XWiki get by with JRE or does it require JDK?  
sdumitriu - (22/05/2009 16:50): It should work with just JRE, but I admit I haven't tried  
kraze - (22/05/2009 16:50): ok  
kraze - (22/05/2009 16:52): is there a minimum java version it requires?  
sdumitriu - (22/05/2009 16:52): Yes, 1,5  
kraze - (22/05/2009 16:55): sdumitriu: remember our conversation yesterday regarding the "Menu on the right" thing that I made into custom panels?... and that one that's called "News" that pointed to the blogs feature and you told me that blogs was slightly broken in 1.4?  
sdumitriu - (22/05/2009 16:56): Yes  
kraze - (22/05/2009 16:57): I'm up to 1.8.4 now and things seem to be working fine.  I was wondering if there's a way for me to re-create that news panel now  
kraze - (22/05/2009 17:01): I only found the blog application for v1.4 and previous  
kraze - (22/05/2009 17:01): In my 1.8.4 test environment, my "News" blog is empty  
kraze - (22/05/2009 17:05): hmm, after further inspection, the news items I had may not be of much value.  it contains only two links, one of which is broken, and the one that isn't broken contains two of four broken links  
kraze - (22/05/2009 17:06): recreating the news items should be easy once I get that custom panel created.  
kaaloo1 joined #xwiki at 17:23  
kaaloo left at 17:23 (Read error: 113 (No route to host))  
florinciu left at 17:33 ("ChatZilla 0.9.84 [Firefox 3.0.10/2009042316]")  
mflorea left at 17:46 ("Leaving")  
anamarias joined #xwiki at 17:59  
arkub left at 18:43 (Read error: 113 (No route to host))  
anamarias left at 18:47 ()  
kraze - (22/05/2009 18:53): is there a way to have tomcat re-read the xwiki.cfg without restarting the tomcat service?  
sdumitriu - (22/05/2009 18:53): No  
sdumitriu - (22/05/2009 18:54): It works if you undeploy and redeploy the xwiki webapp  
sdumitriu - (22/05/2009 18:54): From the tomcat manager  
KermitTheFragger left at 19:02 ("Leaving")  
lucaa joined #xwiki at 19:03  
arunreddy - (22/05/2009 19:09): search mockup  
cypromis left at 19:10 ()  
kraze - (22/05/2009 19:24): I'm getting a lot of "[WARNING] Deprecated usage of getter [com.xpn.xwiki.api.Document.getWeb] in ...".  Should that be something to worry about?  
sdumitriu - (22/05/2009 19:26): Yes  
sdumitriu - (22/05/2009 19:26): This means that your documents are using a deprecated API  
sdumitriu - (22/05/2009 19:26): getWeb was replaced by getSpace  
sdumitriu - (22/05/2009 19:27): You should search for the places where the warning is raised, and update the document  
sdumitriu - (22/05/2009 19:27): In the future deprecated calls might be removed  
kraze - (22/05/2009 19:28): hmm, ok  
vmassol\_ - (22/05/2009 19:34): sdumitriu: and the future isn't far.... 2.0 will probably remove the old apis  
vmassol\_ - (22/05/2009 19:34): (2.0 is planned for early september)  
vmassol\_ - (22/05/2009 19:34): s/sdumitriu/kraze/  
kraze - (22/05/2009 19:38): 1.0 to 2.0 syntax conversion doesn't seem to be working too well for my old pages.  is it as good as it's going to get or will we see improvements before everything is 2.0?  
kraze - (22/05/2009 19:40): sdumitriu: what exactly am I looking for in my documents to resolve this getter error?  
sdumitriu - (22/05/2009 19:40): Well, the log should contain a location  
sdumitriu - (22/05/2009 19:40): Either a document or a template name (.vm)  
sdumitriu - (22/05/2009 19:41): Open it, and search for web  
sdumitriu - (22/05/2009 19:41): And replace with space  
vmassol\_ - (22/05/2009 19:43): kraze: you're on 1.8.4?  
kraze - (22/05/2009 19:43): vmassol\_: yes  
vmassol\_ - (22/05/2009 19:43): we had some issues in 1.8.3 but we fixed them in 1.8.4  
vmassol\_ - (22/05/2009 19:43): kraze: let us know through the list or jira of any problem  
vmassol\_ - (22/05/2009 19:43): (jira preferred)  
vmassol\_ - (22/05/2009 19:44): with explanations on how to reproduce   
kraze - (22/05/2009 19:44): ok, looks like I may have quite a few.  I'll try to get those posted ASAP  
vmassol\_ - (22/05/2009 19:44): thanks  
vmassol\_ - (22/05/2009 19:44): try to reduce the pb to the minimal ex that'll fail  
vmassol\_ - (22/05/2009 19:44): that'll help us  
kraze - (22/05/2009 19:44): ok  
vmassol\_ - (22/05/2009 19:46): kraze: before posting checking if your bug isn't already in this open issue list: http://jira.xwiki.org/jira/secure/IssueNavigator.jspa?reset=true&mode=hide&pid=10010&sorter/order=DESC&sorter/field=priority&resolution=-1&component=10763  
kraze - (22/05/2009 19:46): vmassol\_: ok  
kraze - (22/05/2009 19:47): sdumitriu: I see this in my catalina.out: "[WARNING] Deprecated usage of getter [com.xpn.xwiki.api.Document.getWeb] in Main.WebHome@1,13" which is followed by: "[WARNING] Deprecated usage of method [com.xpn.xwiki.api.Document.getRenderedContent] in /templates/commentsinline.vm@28,40".  Line 28 contains: "<div class="commentcontent">$doc.getRenderedContent($doc.display("comment","view",$comment))      </div>"  
kraze - (22/05/2009 19:48): column 40 would be the "e" in getRenderedContent  
sdumitriu - (22/05/2009 19:49): The commentsInline one is OK  
sdumitriu - (22/05/2009 19:49): It was fixed just in 1.9  
kraze - (22/05/2009 19:50): ok, so ignore this warning for  now?  
sdumitriu - (22/05/2009 19:53): Yes  
sdumitriu - (22/05/2009 19:53): The web ones you should fix  
kraze - (22/05/2009 19:55): ok.  I'm also seeing the same getter error in my log for other pages but it's not referencing a .vm file thereafter.  Editing said pages, I can't find any reference to "web"  
kraze - (22/05/2009 19:56): "[WARNING] Deprecated usage of getter [com.xpn.xwiki.api.Document.getWeb] in Business Continuity Planning.Home@1,13"  
sdumitriu - (22/05/2009 19:57): What does that page contain?  
kraze - (22/05/2009 19:58): the beginning of it contains a custom table of contents which is basically a set of links to other wiki pages in form of "[Some Other Page]"  
sdumitriu - (22/05/2009 19:59): OK, then it's inside a macro  
kraze - (22/05/2009 19:59): bunch of #includeTopic entries  
sdumitriu - (22/05/2009 19:59): Do you have any macro calls?  
kraze - (22/05/2009 20:00): a few {image:someImage.png} entries and the rest looks like basic 1.0 syntax  
kraze - (22/05/2009 20:01): what would a macro call look like?  
kraze - (22/05/2009 20:02): the #includeTopic looks like: #includeTopic("Some Topic")  
kraze - (22/05/2009 20:03): one sec and I'll review the macros WebHome  
kraze - (22/05/2009 20:05): ok, yes.  I have both a Velocity macro (#includeTopic("Some Topic")) and Radeox macro ({image:someimage.png})  
kraze - (22/05/2009 20:05): s/macro/macros/g
